item.title: UK hospitals facing 'worst case scenario' from super flu, doctors warn
item.description: Hospitals in Britain are facing a "worst case scenario" from a wave of super flu, healthcare bosses warned on Thursday, as flu hospitalisations jumped 55 per cent in a week. Health leaders have told people who feel ill to wear face masks when using public transport, while some hospitals are requir

item.title: Shaukat Mahmood put on five-day remand
item.description: A Dhaka court has granted police five days to interrogate Shaukat Mahmood, a former Jatiya Press Club president and Janata Party Bangladesh general secretary, in their custody. Dhaka Metropolitan Magistrate Fahmina Khandakar Anna passed the remand order on Thursday. Sub-Inspector Jinnat Ali of th

item.title: ‘Mango emerges as Bangladesh’s next high-potential export’
item.description: Bangladesh has achieved remarkable export growth in recent years, with the agricultural products steadily gaining traction. item.title: Jamaat Ameer meets Japanese business delegation
item.description: Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami Ameer Dr. Shafiqur Rahman held a meeting on Thursday with a visiting delegation from the Japan External Trade Organization (JETRO), Japan’s official investment and trade promotion body. The meeting was held in a cordial and constructive atmosphere at the Jamaat chi

item.title: M23 consolidates control over Congo town in blow to peace talks
item.description: The M23 rebel group consolidated control over the strategic town of Uvira in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo on Thursday, residents said, as Kinshasa warned that the Rwanda-backed advance could derail US President Donald Trump's efforts to broker peace in the region. item.title: Islami Bank holds 42nd AGM
item.description: The 42nd Annual General Meeting of Islami Bank Bangladesh PLC was held on Thursday (December 11, 2025), at Kurmitola Golf Club of the Capital. Professor Dr. M. item.title: EC seeks two magistrates at upazila level on election duty
item.description: The Election Commission (EC) has asked the public administration ministry to engage at least two executive magistrates at the upazila level immediately after the announcement of polls schedule, said the commission officials. “The commission asked the senior secretary of the public administra

item.title: Students, DUCSU leader chase teacher off campus
item.description: A Dhaka University professor aligned with the Awami League–backed Blue Panel has been chased off campus after students confronted him over an alleged unauthorised meeting at the Faculty of Social Sciences. item.title: Chinese investors meet BGMEA leaders
item.description: A high-level delegation of Chinese investors from a wide range of industries meets with leaders of the Bangladesh Garment Manufacturers and Exporters Association (BGMEA) on Thursday to explore opportunities for diversified investment in Bangladesh. The meeting, held at the BGMEA Complex in Uttara,

item.title: Bangladesh election, referendum on Feb 12; schedule announced
item.description: The much-sought national election and a referendum on the July (Reform) Charter will simultaneously be held on February 12 (Thursday) under a non-political government after 18 years, as the Election Commission announced the schedule on Thursday evening. item.title: Police HQ besieged demanding IGP’s resignation
item.description: Police headquarters have been besieged by the Shaheed Pintu Smriti Sangsad, demanding the resignation of Inspector General of Police Baharul Alam. item.title: Jamuna Bank signs Foreign Remittance Drawing Agreement with Horizon Remit SdnBhd, Malaysia
item.description: Jamuna Bank PLC has recently entered into a Foreign Remittance Drawing Agreement with Horizon Remit SdnBhd in Malaysia, marking a significant milestone in strengthening its global remittance network.
